hKVKOfPCoI6iAUjIImMoDg.text: i love my chinese food, which is why it was the first on my list to find after moving to london. a friend introduced this place to us and it has become a regular dining option. prices are reasonable if you don't order anything extravagent. food is legitimately chinese, unlike a lot of the westernized chinese restaurants in chinatown. their roast duck on rice is my favorite dish to get. for no nonsense, cheap, quality chinese food, gold mine is where its at.

IH6L_su1xY14g7J6yMsFXg.text: I am not an expert yet on Chinese food in London, but this place was solid.  Great hot and sour soup and the duck and veg dishes we got were very good.  Service is okay.  As I got there later than my friends and they had already ordered, I didn't get the full picture here, but I would go back.

AObjSnYz0o-p0NFboZX8Lg.text: The food was delicious...until I got food poisoning. I'll never be able to eat duck again.

CKitHOv6KtmUdJOlT8UIjA.text: It's all about their roasted meats, especially the duck. It's as good as anything you'd find in a restaurant in Hong Kong.

iVcCRr3V-hjy5EehFuKi3A.text: Since the chef from Four Season joined, this eatery has become the place to go for excellent chinese food. Food are all in good portion sized, and perfectly cooked. We tried its lobsters noodles and it's so tasty that we almost bit our tongue. Highly recommended for chinese food lovers.

WAHteuutVmsdRBEg1mdA5A.text: Gold mine prawns are the best!!! :)

1CxhJ1fnux0p1EzIFAIpMQ.text: Not a fan if this joint. I was intrigued by the number of people milling outside and waiting for a table. I came in to get take away and the charge to get a side of white rice is nearly 3 quid!  That's a truly ridiculous price for white rice. Plus when my food finally arrived, it came out ice cold. The flavor of the duck has a very strong iron taste--vaguely bloody and not in a good way. Anyway, over priced amount of food.*Maybe the duck is good served hot and fresh but I am underwhelmed.

OYZOXxVUgelb7-dAXdcYmA.text: Great food, the owner is very nice but the maitre d' has all the personality of an undertaker.  No excuse for that.Tried the Kung Pao chicken, it was completely different from the versions in Southern California but superb.  The other dishes were excellent as well.  Oddly enough, when we asked for a side of rice they quoted £3, and for a small bowl of hot and sour soup it was £3.30.  I didn't want to buy the place settings, just the food!I'd go back, but you have to be careful with the side dishes.

PlSm32cmcJkiTZ6WfgSvog.text: Somehow, my countrymen have decided to descend on this place in the droves. I was there tonight, and within a 5 minute window, a good friend from Singapore and my own cousin walked in right behind each other. (No, they don't know each other, and no, I didn't know they were coming to London). I guess this place passes the Asian quota (unlike some Ba*a*a Tr€€ places I've been to :) - Still don't know why people go there). Anyway, it is as people say, one of the best places for a good Roast Duck. Always go boneless - it's just easier. Don't order the Siew Yok (pork belly) there are better places for it. But a good combo that is basically my regular order:1. Roast Duck (boneless)2. Aubergine with minced pork3. Salt and Chili squid 4. Pei pa Tofu5. an order of green veg stir fried with garlic.Boom done. Thanks and good night.

bW_H24Ao7AxW6Y2cDWD1sw.text: Typical chinese decor and okay service. I never expect very friendly service in a Chinese restaurant anyway. I tried the chef special tofu stuffed with eggplant, bell peppers and shrimp and also the bamboo and mushroom platter. Both dishes were good and came out steaming hot. Decent portions and good quality.

photos.caption: Photo of Gold Mine - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Gold Mine - London, United Kingdom

l3DNhHYRTOUt623oYHQNQQ.text: After payday, I decided to treat the in-laws to dinner. They've very traditional Cantonese, so they'll only eat at places they're used to. The same could probably be said for the "locals" that queued up to get inside. MY cunning brain knew about the possible queues on a Saturday night so I reserved a table. Typically with most Chinese restaurants, its all about filling the tables, meaning our table was NOT reserved despite us arriving 10mins early. After a 30min wait the, waiter apologised and offer us free house soup. Unfortunately we're all to used to being treated in this conveyor belt type service: wait your turn, eat, bill arrives before your last bite, get shunted out so that they can once again fill the table.I can't complain about the food. It IS good and you can find many traditional dishes, despite the obligatory lemon chicken and spring rolls for westernised tastes. Duck is comparable to Four Season, but is it better/worse? You decide.My one recommendation would be the chefs special: Japanese tofu with pork and mushrooms served in a clay pot.

BV_2CmPw-9y0oADEfIKvKQ.text: Rumour has it among the Chinese community that the best roast duck in town crown has passed from Four Seasons just up the road in Queensway to Gold Mine. In common with Four Seasons, they will offer to take the duck off the bone here.The English speaking staff are friendly and efficient.The duck is certainly tender with a good amount of meat and I get a plate of this to go with whatever noodle or rice based dish that tickles my fancy on that particular day. I would certainly recommend that you give Gold Mine a go if you're after good roast duck

VB0BDPU4Yx-mlf1tQYkyMg.text: Alright, this is place is definitely a place to try when in England. My friend recommended me to come eat here and stated that it's an England must even though it sounds odd. My friend was definitely right! This place has the most succulent duck and "cha siu". I practically devoured that duck. The "cha siu" was really good and not dry, it's just sad they sell out! But once you taste it you'll understand why. The duck is not dry, and I cant express more how succulent it is. Why I docked stars is because the server, ANN or ANNA, single-handled destroyed my appetite. We ordered type A vegetables and when the vegetables was served it was type B. We told the another server nicely, "umm we ordered type A, is it possible to change it? if not it's fine we'll just take it then." ANN or ANNA looked and saw us and just screamed, "That's what you ordered!" My friend and I know the differences between our vegetables, alright. And we asked for an exchange not your life. So they took the vegetables and NEVER came back with another. At that point we were full anyways so we didnt want to bother arguing. The whole time ANN or ANNA gave a face like she someone held crap right under her nose.Then the second time when I came in to buy take out. I ordered my take-out and went to go buy some souvenirs while we waited for it to be ready. Once again, none of ANN or ANNA's business she decided to butt in and kill my appetite and fuel my anger towards how terrible of a service this extremely yummy place has. I came back for my take out to pay for the order and pick it up. I walk in and asked the first lady I saw, "i'm here for my take out." The lady tells ANN or ANNA, this lady is here for her take out. and ANN or ANNA yells, "DID SHE PAY YET?!" oh my gosh.. seriously? like people ask for the food and run?? you didnt even tell me the price yet, how the heck am I suppose to know how much to pay you? That's why i'm here to pick up the take out? sheesh. Such a demeaning tone. She seriously needs to change her service ways, or probably more people will stop going even if the food is awesome. Totally dont want to see her or be served by her.

bh0MKYEXvgR2GAyCy_8NiQ.text: I went here with my GF's family who are Chinese.  We had a big group of about 10-12.  We ordered almost everything off the menu.  It was fantastic.  I got to try lots of things I would have never ordered myself.  Somethings good, somethings not to my liking.  But nonetheless, everyone I was with was very pleased with the food and service.Its a small place and it got very crowded, but I didn't mind, it's London.

photos.caption: Photo of Gold Mine - London, United Kingdom. Good stuff

KyxhOqUpFfXmQzq3wuy62A.text: The food was quite bad, but the service was 100 times worse. Won't be coming back here.

kqWvpeVyy18XeH5_ZLNtaA.text: Not bad! The roast duck was good - lots of succulent meat and good flavor. The rest - aubergine in pot, sautéed green beans, minced pork with salted fish, etc. - was tasty enough but nothing amazing. Slightly above average Chinese food. We paid about £20/person for a table of four and a total of five dishes, which was a bit pricey. Credit cards accepted.

_rUuHVouGkt23WxySHjZKA.text: i have eaten here every time i'm in london for their great roast duck which can come deboned (yes!!!).i ask for the sauce on the side as it can overwhelm the dish.their vegetable and rice dishes are yummy too as id the chashu(roast pork).some times the service can be a little rushed so don't go during the busy lunch hours and weekends.

o7HJ42aKfP8ESaOzTmGZvw.text: This is generally a fail-safe place to go for food in the area. Given the amount of competition in the area, you've got to be good at what you do in order to survive as long as Gold Mine has. The duck, as people have mentioned, is indeed very good here. What I tend to go for, however, is the stewed brisket of lamb with dry bean curd and a Japanese bean curd dish. The former, other than the most recent time I was here, has always proved to be nothing short of mouthwateringly delicious. They did their best to ensure a fast turnaround by bringing the bill to our table unasked, but, other than that, service was pretty decent. For instance, the waitress brought over our bowls of nai tong without being asked unlike some other Chinese restaurants. Also, they do take credit cards now. Just not American Express.

X6Nz1uwVdZSSxfMQ6r7H1g.text: Not as good as Four Seasons, but still a pretty competent duck rice place. Neither siew yok or duck rice compares to that of Four Seasons (in Chinatown)

j8l-JWIRsQ0qFSJDPyQFBw.text: four seasons used to be the go to place for roast ducks but the service there has gone from bad to worse and now gold mine is the substitute!and a very capable and close substitute i must add.one thing is for sure, the service here is much better than four seasons.no arrogance whatsoever.you probably cant tell their roast ducks apart.same crispy skin, tender meat and tasty sauce served on a similar bed of chinese cabbage.the chilli oil is just as good too.and if you are a regular here, you will enjoy their soup of the day for free! especially nice on a cold day.their stir fried kai lan(kale) was well cooked.crunchy stems that were not overcooked and nicely coated with garlic sauce.the steamed minced pork with prawn, salted fish and slivers of shredded ginger was comfort food reminiscent of good old childhood days!the roast pork was not that great today.skin was not crispy enough and meat slightly tough.the pi pa tofu was yummy.nice consistency which comes from the specially blended tofu mixture.oh btw my suspicion is that the two restaurants are related.one time i went there for takeaway and they ran out of roast ducks.i saw the staff leave the restaurant only to come back with 2 roast ducks in a bag!!! that's my conspiracy theory.:)

XnwNrZVeg_7iC_5t6BVjpg.text: Gold Mine is one of the best Chinese restaurants I've found in London.  It reminds me of some of the crazy good places in Chinatown in Toronto.  Went there with a group of 10 people a few weeks ago.  When they asked, "what do you recommend" I said that I'd never had a bad dish.  They went crazy ordering stuff and sure enough, there wasn't a single clunker in the lot.I seriously love this place.Also, the roast duck is sublime.

KLkSttPp0EO0U_t0Qaz9jA.text: The owners of Gold Mine are the former owners of Four Seasons, who eventually sold the business to the Royal China group in 2007. For regular Four Seasons patrons, you'll recognise the manager (uncle in glasses). The head waiter is Malaysian (I met him eating breakfast one day in Malaysia Hall), and some of the other staff are also Malaysian, which helps to explain their claypot fish curry (see below).Anyway, the roast duck is good, and you can ask them to debone the duck so that it's easier to eat. We usually have half a duck, with their "pei pa" taufu (house specialty), garlic kai lan, salt & pepper squid, black pepper beef.Duck - their have a very nice sauce with the duck, which is slightly sweeter than Four Seasons (which has a more herbal taste). The duck itself is nice and moist, and is not as fatty as the ducks at Four Seasons (up to personal preference).Taufu - large pieces of deep fried taufu, stuffed with minced pork and prawns, served with a mushroom sauce, and baby bak choy. This is their house specialty taufu, and is very tasty.Claypot fish curry - this is the real star of the show, the unsung hero of Gold Mine. Not many people know that Gold Mine serves a very authentic Malaysian claypot fish curry (lemak curry style) that Malaysians will recognise instantly. It comes in a claypot, with pieces of fish coated in batter (I'm not fond of the batter), swimming in a rich curry with loads of herbs, curry leaves, etc. I've brought my Malaysian friends to this place, and they all agree that it is very authentic. It is, however, quite oily, so be warned.More often than not, u'd get their soup of the day on the house. Service can be rushed when it's busy, as they have a small place, so they rely on turnover. When they first opened, it was less busy, so you could sit there and enjoy your meal. These days, you'll be given the bill if the place is full. If you want somewhere to slowly enjoy a meal, I suggest either coming early or late, or going somewhere else. If you're happy to enjoy the food and then head somewhere else for a drink to catch up with friends, then this is a great place for food.

emVv-sGKZq28KwkvWZepQg.text: Gold mine seems like it's a gold mine for the owner with many customers in the know realising they can get the wonderful duck famous at the Four Seasons at this place without having to line up. This place is also a little bit more newer and looks much less manic without the constant queue blocking the doorway. The duck is good and the rest of the food that I've had here is fairly reasonable, though still not as good as the rest of the Four Seasons menu. One of the biggest downsides to this place is that it only takes cash, unlike many of the Chinese restaurants along this street. They don't even take debit cards.

-0CNPHgP3_POJ8aFOvk9Tg.text: This is where the famed barbecue chef from Four Seasons nearby moved to, and you'll certainly be impressed by the roast duck (though not as much as I used to be at Four Seasons, surprisingly). But more than just roast duck, my friends and I enjoyed their Szechuan chicken and roast pork. Staff are generally friendly, but it can get very busy at times, and service does tend to deteriorate. Nevertheless, if your dishes are standard (e.g. roast duck, pork), don't expect to be able to go to the loo and back before your food comes. We found the price reasonable, at about 10 pounds per person for a solid meal.

wb1jr63Sq9SrMQ-AqCspZA.text: This is a fail-safe Cantonese restaurant in Bayswater. Each time I go to this restaurant I'll vouch for the roasted duck. It's a great place to go to with a group of people, where you can order other food from the menu and share around the table - that's what Chinese eating is about! The tofu is yummy as with the honey pork chop. Price wise, it never leave a hole in my pocket.

ZMad5eldQJPU5TnxpJewaw.text: Not bad. I think their best dish, by far, is the BBQ pork (char siu). Nothing remarkable apart from that, I think. For amazing duck, go to Four Seasons next door.

7imTKCAM03dKSP__gbnBHw.text: Authentic Cantonese food in Paddington.This Chinese restaurant is well known for the delicious "Peking Duck".

photos.caption: Photo of Gold Mine - London, United Kingdom. Yummy eggplant cantonese style
Photo of Gold Mine - London, United Kingdom. Big Won Tan Soup

yWuHtI1jIEPY6EED749Jvw.text: A friend of mine took me there two weeks ago. He said they had really good duck, and I was like, oh, well, you know, I've had good duck before. My Vietnamese aunt actually makes the best duck in the workd. But sounds cool.But that duck is AMAZING (almost as good as my aunt's). The place is quite successful so you might have to wait a little bit but it is worth it (I don't say that very often, sadly for someone who lives in London I'm not a huge fan of queuing for food).We shared a £8.50 portion of duck (obviously), some garlic veggies that were just crunchy and savoury and perfect, and some salt and pepper squid - very good but I could never eat a whole plate of that by myself, it's not very light!It is very reasonably priced and even with beers it cost us under £40 for the two of us. I will definitely go back!

photos.caption: Photo of Gold Mine - London, United Kingdom. Oh, that duck...

L6uddACJ1nCfvqY6SdSHjg.text: Great Chinese food at an affordable price! Conveniently located by Bayswater station on the Main Street.The duck is a must have. Delicious and succulent, prepared in the traditional BBQ way. We also had the rice crepes which was one of the best I've ever had. Short wait for a table but well worth it!

amh9PAV_jXiBDA6BkQ8iQw.text: We went here because my wife was craving "English chineese food" and they had great rating. In the dining area where it was full upon our arrival there where mainly asian customers wich to us was a good sign. We started off by sharing the "Crispy aromatic duck" wich is a fried and pulled version of the famous Peking duck served also with pancakes, cucumber, scallions and hoi sin. It was crispy and really good in flavors and 1/4 was enough as a starter with 3 pancakes each. Then i had the chicken szechuan that i thought was a bit different and felt more like a spicy sweet and sour sauce the szechaun i have had before (yes i have been to China for Those wondering). The flavors where ok though but the serving size could have been bigger. The Mrs was happy with her chicken in lemonsauce wich i personally felt was bit boring but thats just a matter of opinion. She has had it many times in the U.K and said it was good. The service was fast but without a smile or any "extras". Funny reading reviews about the friendly staff when i didnt see a single one of the roughly 6 waiters smile halfhearted in all my meal. Hmm ok so we where not there to socialize but it felt abit rushed as they wanted to serve us, get paid and then get some new customers taking our table. Dont like to be rushed when im at a restaurant so this also affects my grade.  Prices "ok" for U.K and the food was ok but i cant say this is a "must go" to place for chineese food in London.

Mp-qgzvIX6BUG5BbvawDUA.text: Conveniently location, fast service, good quality bbq meat (tried the roast duck), in general a very positive experience.I have a feeling I'd be getting a lot of take-away boxes here...

photos.caption: Photo of Gold Mine - London, United Kingdom. nice takeout

Ke5UHVa3tD8d2SSxazfosA.text: Roasted duck - Goldmine, QueenswayGoldmine has been taking over Four Seasons for London's best roasted duck for the last few years. The ratio of fat and meat was very balanced. The meat was so juicy and tender. Compared to other Chinese restaurant, Goldmine 's sauce is not as sweet but more on the savoury side. You don't feel greasy afterwards. I just don't like the fact that they deboned it

photos.caption: Photo of Gold Mine - London, United Kingdom

m_Nvi6y37MvAzzc5friHeg.text: Such a great food!!! Totally love it! I recommend all of dim sum and gyoza!!! So delicious and portion sizes are huge ! The staff members are really nice ,helpful and it's just great to come back to this restaurant!

ilPS_g34pGN2d1pcZlA3PA.text: If I was a duck, I'd want this place to cook me. Took away their roast duck rice last night. There was a perfect duck meat to fat ratio and the sauce was more savoury than sweet - something else that I like a lot. This place is often compared to (sshh) Four Seasons, just down the road. Honestly, I prefer this place. Four Seasons is great, but their duck is fattier than I'd usually prefer and their sauce is rather sweet as well. The duck skin is crispier at Gold Mine too. Though, which restaurant you prefer probably comes down to personal taste. Try both and make your own decision if you can! If not, I'd recommend you eat at Gold Mine first.

UeRtbUrrI0-Knept9J4fkg.text: Whoever said this was the best Cantonese restaurant has not been to Hong Kong or San Francisco. The so-called chefs special shredded chicken chow mein was dry, salty and tasteless. Wasted £8 on this horrible dish - remove it from the menu.

pxR1TVQNXKnkkEuHXh_uXw.text: Well authentic, except that the service is far too polite to be truly Cantonese. Had the roast duck, roast pork and a stir fried kailan in oyster sauce. Roast duck is tasty - meat was tender and moist, very nice and consistent layer of subcutaneous fat. We opted for a deboned duck, and the chef's deboning skills are excellent - not even a bone fragment. However,  skin was not as crispy as we would have liked - just a touch too soft for our preference. Roast pork was decent, skin was very crispy and there was a good proportion of fat to meat. However, the meat was just slightly over salted. Stir-fried veggie was way over salted. While the veggies were well sautéed, the chef just got way too carried away with the oyster sauce. I'm a huge fan of Cantonese style roast duck, and I'm blessed to have regular access to really good duck back home. This place definitely isn't the best, but for London I reckon it's as good as it gets. Well worth a try if you've never tried Cantonese roast duck.

rGz7nWWrvlpqKeVqV0monw.text: Delicious Dim sum! Went to this location for lunch, service was quick and food was superb. The group had the fried duck egg roll and it was excellent. The pork buns are also worth trying. Would highly recommend for lunch!

8IapbLTJ5VT-ypubViWsEw.text: Simply best Cantonese in London. Peking duck is as amazing as it can theoretically get - crispy skin, very moderate fat((which is quite rare in Chinese restaurants, as most of them have verry fat ducks), and nice sauce.Another highlight - shrimps. Just wonderful. Must try.Crispy pork is also very tender and aromatic.The only 2 things which slightly disappointed(compared to those 3 ones above) were sweet-and-sour-soup and beef.

nlcF3bKQ1GSsmobWPeKiiQ.text: Outstanding roast duck. These guys are Cantonese and know what they're doing.Trust me I'm Singaporean and have had excellent Peking duck in Asia. This is comparable to those in Asia. Worth a try.Extremely popular with asians and always crowded. Nuff said

photos.caption: Photo of Gold Mine - London, United Kingdom. Roast duck, comparable to asian standards

HzKOsVXxL4ig7m0I9hzuSg.text: We had a GREAT dinner here after a movie at the Odoen Whiteleys.  Everything was fresh, flavorful and well enjoyed.  Highly recommended!

photos.caption: Photo of Gold Mine - London, United Kingdom. view from our table in the back room
Photo of Gold Mine - London, United Kingdom. chicken chow mein
Photo of Gold Mine - London, United Kingdom. sizzling beef

LokmDFJMCcvObngE0yg-Ng.text: They may have the best Peking Duck in London. V. busy for dinner. Ron Swason would say "The food is incredible. Please eat it. Thank you. End of review."

x8ZNWnvQuGd05fIJ54evbQ.text: The line was long and it took 1 hour to get a table! Traditional Chinese sharing tables during peak hours if your party is less than 4. The roast duck is delicious and has a good fat to meat ratio. I ordered morning glory vegetables and that was delicious. Tofu seafood bowl was good but not amazing. The sizzling beef was okay. Overall fast service but they got confused by some dishes that was for the other party we were sharing on the same table. Will go back for the roast duck for sure!! And will try their noodle dishes next time!

photos.caption: Photo of Gold Mine - London, United Kingdom. Red bean dessert.
Photo of Gold Mine - London, United Kingdom. Roast duck! Yum!!
Photo of Gold Mine - London, United Kingdom. Feast!

yyfGzI5dcfG2eY8kUcx4Ow.text: This place does excellent duck off the bone. The interior is clean and pleasant. Each dish is good for sharing. The spinach we ordered could have comfortably fed 4-5 people. The curried lamb was quite delicious too, lots of cinnamon and star anise in it. Soup was a simple chicken and sweetcorn and there was nothing wrong at all with it.In all, this place is special not because it does anything extremely well, but because it does almost everything right with little fuss. The limited dessert range was disappointing, but it's likely because they were about to close when we wanted to order this. We managed to order a red bean pastry dessert which was probably frozen and a little oily without the normally customary sago pudding dessert.In all, if you're looking for some decent Chinese around Bayswater and don't want to risk disappointment, then Gold Mine is the safe bet. There are a lot of cantonese people that eat here. A good sign.Otherwise there are plenty of Malaysian restaurants around due to the ex-pat community, and the nearby Malaysian hall, but the quality of these places aren't close to the cuisine you'd actually find in Malaysia. So again chinese here might be the safest bet.

photos.caption: Photo of Gold Mine - London, United Kingdom. Curried lamb
Photo of Gold Mine - London, United Kingdom. Tofu
Photo of Gold Mine - London, United Kingdom. Spinach, curry lamb, tofu

NC_M5Pm1ScttC_H2Vce5qw.text: A tourist in London, Yelp really came to the rescue when I had serious Chinese food cravings. Gold Mine did the trick. The restaurant was packed Tuesday night with both Chinese and non-Chinese folks. Three of us ordered Beijing duck, veggies, and tofu. Everything was right on authentic and now I'm drooling just reminicing about it.

photos.caption: Photo of Gold Mine - London, United Kingdom

n8hNTtWPGJrShQ4PDEC93w.text: I heard many great things about this place from my Malaysian friends but only came to this place for the first time recently.The roast duck I had lived up to my expectation. I went to heaven for 1s after the first bite. It was soft, juicy and tasted divine. The side dishes which my friend ordered were also great. We had spicy tofu minced pork in a clay pot, stir fry kailan, yummy shrimp dish (not so sure the exact name). A very standard satisfying oriental meal (especially for a international student in London like me)The only minor complain is the service here. But I am willing to look past that since it is such a busy place. In fact, the place was so packed that there was hardly any room to move.And one small tip: there is a place called "tinseltown" near the restaurant. If you still have room for dessert, I suggest you come there and treat yourself another round with ferrero rocher milkshake. I actually even bought giant bubble wand in a pound shop and play with it when I was having my milkshake. (In case you were wondering, yes, conveniently there is also a poundshop from Goldmine to Tinsel Town that sells F*** underwear - you get the idea haha) Divine roast duck + Milk shake + Bubble = Perfect night out :)

photos.caption: Photo of Gold Mine - London, United Kingdom. This food made my week :) yum yum

Ea5C3xqF9gi6MWnB2fqNbg.text: Just focus on the boneless roast duck, that the best dish on the menu. Saw many taking away the whole duck which cost about 22 pound each

photos.caption: Photo of Gold Mine - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Gold Mine - London, United Kingdom. Boneless duck

fUyQCxpFdDLmsSP0wRxKHA.text: Ah, its been a while since I've been to Gold Mine, and after my recent meal I kicked myself for not coming back earlier!They've now expanded to take over the next door restaurant, so they have loads of tables and space, so while you still have to wait without a reservation, the wait is much shorter.Some of the favourite dishes, that you have to order here:- Roast duck, of course- Pork belly with yam- three types of stuffed vegetables (from the chefs special menu at the back)Pricing is good, portions are big (get 3-4 dishes to share between 4-5 people), and the food arrives quick but hot and fresh.

vKOuZtGo6rdLx5fZ2yzm6A.text: I would give this place 5 stars if they would have simply heated up my Duck! It ordered take out, half an order of Duck (which was highly recommended) and won tong soup, they were both really good just really sucked that when I got to my hotel room I had cold duck...it's really good but PLEASE heat up take out duck, why would anyone want cold duck?! Also heads up, this place is super crowded!

CMGwOspfYijW0mdQQ_SZIg.text: Thank goodness this is nearby my hotel. The duck is soooo good! I missed food from back home (Singapore) and this really satisfied my cravings. Will definitely visit this place again! 100%

0YLE92IGpkCUP5W5UQ6fhA.text: Tastes here are traditional Cantonese & the signature dish is the roast duck.  Except these are giant British ducks. 3 guys couldn't finish 1/2 a bird.   It was tasty but that was a big bird.  Also, our food, included the vegetables which had to be cooked after we ordered it, came in about 3 minutes.  Food tastes great... but expect the table to be turned over because the place is full & your food will come fast.

photos.caption: Photo of Gold Mine - London, United Kingdom.
Photo of Gold Mine - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Gold Mine - London, United Kingdom.

WWPtKj0qaDfW4xJQkxyjBA.text: BEST ROAST DUCK IN THE WORLD! Hands down. I can eat the whole duck myself. Get it off the bone, mandatory to make a reservation if you want to get a table if not there's no guarantee as they're always full.

ixVWr7iZoXmbDPUnrEnewg.text: Great food. Use real crab in their soup which was yummy! The Singapore noodles were disappointing- not spicy and were oily and lacked flavor...& not the place to go as a solo dinner. Service sucked...ignored me and rushed me (simultaneously achieving that feat is hard). Clean toilets  can see I am scrapping the barrel here. My favourite three places in neighborhood were full and regret trying a new place instead of waiting...I did request extra beansprouts and they accommodated this request so hence the 3 stars

photos.caption: Photo of Gold Mine - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Gold Mine - London, United Kingdom

C4SxivZvDVRT9nyuBY13cg.text: We came here on our last night in London to try their signature dish - the Cantonese Roast Duck, and it did not disappoint. The whole duck was more than enough for four people to share. I also ordered the Sizzling Aubergine in Spicy Sauce, which was cooked well and came in a hot plate.

photos.caption: Photo of Gold Mine - London, United Kingdom. Roast duck
Photo of Gold Mine - London, United Kingdom. Sizzling Aubergine

9j0eT8OVBg4737cpblOMhg.text: You are either a Gold Mine duck fan or a Four Seasons one and I'm definitely a die hard Gold Mine fan. Gold Mine ducks are usually fattier than Four Season ducks which make them much juicier. I have transported their duck by hand via plane for family members who just love it so much - if you let the Gold Mine staff know, they will make the necessary arrangements for you so it still tastes good after 12 hours across oceans!Their other items that comes in the sizzling woks are really good too. Have been here multiple times and have never been disappointed.

DxgCpGWxjRPEJjQehDk76w.text: Walked over to Pret to get a quick lunch after landing in London and saw a line out the door at this Chinese restaurant.  Sort of weird, I thought.  We tried it a couple of times - once as take-out and once dine-in.  It's more 4 to 4.5 stars, but close enough.  The honey pork was our favorite, but all the basic stir-fries were excellent.  It's authentic Cantonese food at a reasonable, tasty price.Be ware if you do take-out, they don't have plastic plates.  The steamed rice portions are also larger than what we're used to in the States, so don't order too many.

8pHICT5ECW1NkdpHB7UYMA.text: So many reviews extolling the roast duck at Gold mine on Yelp, that I had bookmarked it eons ago. For some reason, I'd never eaten here though. (I have lunch in this area every 7-10 days and end up at My default picks for Thai or Spanish food most of the time)This time I set out determined to eat the roast duck at Gold Mine and check what the fuss was all about.Oh my! That duck was gorgeous! The fat melting in the mouth was like a beautiful piece of pork fat - I've never tasted duck fat like that & at the same time the skin was crispy too and the meat ever so tender.My favourite meat is pork, but the barbecued pork (also good) did not hold a candle to this roast duck! I chose the Singapore vermicelli noodles to go with my meal. They were just what I wanted - really thin fine noodles, fried up street food style and just perfect with the fat of that perfect duck. All 3 dishes for 22£.I've got to take the family here to try this duck. I was lucky to not have to brave a queue at 2:30pm, but the restaurant was quite full. However, I must say that standing in line would be worth it for this roast duck. Just the duck & a side of noodles or rice would be perfect.

photos.caption: Photo of Gold Mine - London, United Kingdom. Smoked chicken (it was sweet this time) chicken spring rolls & pork grilled dumplings #LiveLifeLikeLDN
Photo of Gold Mine - London, United Kingdom. Prawn crackers - to be ordered & paid for #LiveLifeLikeLDN
Photo of Gold Mine - London, United Kingdom. Hot & sour chicken soup #LiveLifeLikeLDN

CcLfKs4VGOSnJkOAhm7f6w.text: Talking about famous Cantonese Roast Duck.  This restaurant has also one of the best cantonese roast duck in London.  Rumour has it that the chefs from Four Seasons actually worked here for some time before going back to Four Seasons again.  Unsure the reason.  Dispute??Anyway, I have to say the tenderness of the duck here is equal to the one in Four Seasons.  No difference.  The difference lies in the ratio of the fat of the duck and the sauce that accompanies the duck.  The duck fat here is less compared to Four Seasons and is more lean.  So healthier.  That said, who in the right mind would want to eat Cantonese Roast Duck and be healthy.  So this is negligible.  The sauce which accompanies the duck here however seems to be more to the savoury side compared to the one in Four Seasons.  The one in Four Seasons is slightly sweeter.  I prefer the Four Seasons slightly sweeter version.I do not see much difference in the duck to be honest.  Both of them were cooked similarly.  The other chinese food here I cannot comment much as I haven't really tried much.  But probably a bit slightly better than Four Seasons.  The staff here are also much nicer and more polite compared to the one in Four Seasons.  You expect to be scolded and shouted at in Four Seasons.  To those who cannot stand rude staff and long queues, I would probably recommend Gold Mine.

photos.caption: Photo of Gold Mine - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Gold Mine - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Gold Mine - London, United Kingdom

ixqbEr9zJNsEhVG1X3Ky3A.text: We ordered half roasted duck and chicken chow mein, it was delicious. A very clean place.

KGQ00HUWV-nsd0mf1hSS5A.text: Great authentic Cantonese food, the duck and roast meats are amazingly juicy. Service is typically gruff but efficient. Overall, a little better than Four Seasons to be honest.

Td0JFHHgyIocFMQOV2spOg.text: Didn't think we would eat Chinese food in London. But dimsum was pretty good compared to the ones we have in NYC.

hLOa9NgkQTGm_gyiFE04RA.text: Daughter and I loved the outside menu so we went in...were promptly seated with excellent service. The prices are reasonable and the establishment is clean and well organized. We felt like soup. Daughter had the roast duck with noodles soup and I had the shredded duck and vermicelli noodle soup. So much food...we couldn't finish. The soups were good, though slightly bland and greasy...but that's duck. We ended up trading soups. We'd love to come back and try one of the other many dishes offered.

photos.caption: Photo of Gold Mine - London, United Kingdom

hO2QyrVDJ9k6pecg_SyTdA.text: Great Chinese food and friendly service.  Ordered takeaway and had the roast duck over rice and a separate order of gai lan (chinese broccoli) with garlic for lunch.  I love roast duck and gai lan, so I had reasonably high expectations and fortunately it did not disappoint.  A little surprise bonus was the extra sauce they gave me... I think it was XO or something like it, and it was spicy and the perfect complement to rice!  I also heard some of the staff speaking in Cantonese so this place is legit.  If I lived here I'd be a regular.

owv2BJJpizuL8uEKoi3_bg.text: Quite possibly the most juicy roast duck and the most tender roast pork in London if not the entire U.K. can be found here.I'm told the owner is Malaysia and his version of Malaysian curry is excellent.

KHZfsP7BXmGsl7_WaX5ZMQ.text: I love to order and enjoy the fabulous Peking duck. It's always busy there but you get quick a table and your food. Everyone how works there is professional and friendly.

Wy_PYW5nJ-1ZF7B8KSD31Q.text: Low quality food. We stopped by after a long flight and They stuck my husband and I in a corner - literally facing the wall. They put preference to large groups of 10+ people. The food all had the same syrupy soy sauce. Ingredients were low quality or canned. We ordered a bamboo shoot and mushroom dish and it was a plateful of canned mushrooms with a few mushrooms. Gross. The total came out to $50 with no drinks. Avoid!

6dz1g4aPgJZ-NGqCxGGA4w.text: Food: 4.8/5  Price: 4.8/5  Environment: 4/5Service: 4/5By far one of the best restaurants that serves Cantonese cuisine in London! The food is even better than some of the restaurants in Hong Kong.Their signature dishes, Cantonese roast duck and golden sand prawn, were exceptionally good (SOO GOOD). I had them few weeks ago with my clients. Both dishes had me craving for them in the past few weeks. I ended up going back with my friends, and obviously, they loved them too. Most of their other dishes were also good. The menu is huge and I am sure there are many other delicious dishes.Chinese restaurants are often associated with bad services, but not in Gold Mine. Most of the staff were very welcoming and friendly (at least the three who served us). Another plus was the restaurant is quite spacious, unlike those in China town where you literally have to sit back to back with the table behind you. To sum up, it is now my go-to Cantonese restaurant in London. (Make sure you book in advance as they are busy all the time)

photos.caption: Photo of Gold Mine - London, United Kingdom
